Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  Controller

public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object

Controller class holds the menu for intial setting up of a store and also controls the global time that all components run on so that no other component ever needs to know what tick it is on. Also gathers all the final statistics from other classes when the simulation has completed.

Version:
2011,03,18
Author:
AngryPirates Cabin Boy Greg & Seaman Sam

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main method. Runs initialization menu and controlls the ticks through the program.

menuSystem

public int[] menuSystem()
Menu system uses User Dialog to gather data on Stats Only mode, Speed multiplier for the program and virtual hours it wants to be run.

reportStatistics

public void reportStatistics(int totalTicks,
                             Store myStore,
                             long executionTime)
Handles the output of statistics at the end of the simulation. Outputs to terminal

Parameters:
totalTicks - The total number of ticks the simulation was run for
customerCounter - The total number of customers that came through the store
averageInStore - The average number of customers in the store per hour
averageQueue - The average queue length in the store
shopProfit - The total cash earned from selling items
executionTime - The time the simulation took to run

runController

                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Performs the main operations of the simulation, controlling timings and everything else
